pullrequest.title: Add package.xml to simplify building in catkin workspaces

content.raw:
My experience with catkin has been less than sunny. In addition, the last time ros was leaked into Gazebo ended in a dependency nightmare. I know that a package.xml is not a dependency, but I'm now taking a very clear-cut approach to keep gazebo clean. I also don't want to give any impression that Gazebo is a ros package. It has been a long standing confusion about the origins of Gazebo, and whether it's a ros package or not. 

Additionally, all the information in a package.xml is contained in more acceptable files (README, LICENSE, AUTHORS, CMakeLists.txt). Defining a new "standard" that duplicates current best practices is sub-optimal and goes against the grain of open-source software.

This is partially philosophical and partially practical. Only things necessary to run cmake, and build debians will be included in gazebo and gazebo dependencies. I'm willing to change this approach once catkin is a standalone debian released package that has no ties to ros.
